title: Squeezing light to get non-classical work in quantum engines
authors: A. Tejero, D. Manzano, and P.I. Hurtado
abstract:
Light can be squeezed by reducing the quantum uncertainty of the electric
field for some phases. We show how to use this purely-quantum effect to extract
net mechanical work from radiation pressure in a simple quantum photon engine.
Along the way, we demonstrate that the standard definition of work in quantum
systems is not appropriate in this context, as it does not capture the energy
leaked to these quantum degrees of freedom. We use these results to design an
Otto engine able to produce mechanical work from squeezing baths, in the
absence of thermal gradient. Interestingly, while work extraction from
squeezing generally improves for low temperatures, there exists a nontrivial
squeezing-dependent temperature for which work production is maximal,
demonstrating the complex interplay between thermal and squeezing effects.
